title: Exam 4 (optional cumulative final) - Raw, uncurved score, bonus credit not added
description:
Test information and rules 

Please read very carefully as we will hold you accountable to all of the following rules:

  1. Please make sure you are completely prepared before you begin by reading the Exam Study Guides and by studying as you would for a standard exam.
  2. There will be 45 questions. However, I will divide your number of correct responses by 44.1 so you can make up to a 102% on the exam. 
  3. Unlike the quizzes, you only have one attempt to earn a good score on the exam.
  4. The exam is open notes and open book. 
  5. You are not permitted to take the exam in groups. If we suspect that you took the exam with the help of another student, we are required to report the possible infraction to the university for further investigation.
  6. You will have 95 minutes to complete the exam. The questions are complex so you will have little time to look up information to individual questions. Please be proactive and study well!
  7. All questions are multiple choice and weighted equally. For all questions, select the best possible answer based on the information discussed in the lectures. At times you must select the correct answer from a list of multiple true statements. Pay special attention to italicized and underlined words and phrases to help you determine the key information in each question that will help you select the correct response.
  8. The lateness policy does NOT APPLY TO THE FINAL EXAM. 
  9. If you have disability accommodations, please ensure that the exam time reflects you accommodation before beginning. If it does not, please email your TA asap and we'll update the exam rules. We will not provide second attempts or extra time after you initiate the exam. 
  10. The score displayed to you immediately after the exam does not reflect the built in bonus credit. Also, I usually curve exam scores. Thus the score you see will be lower than the score I record in the gradebook. I will release the final score shortly after the exam closes. 

Good luck!
